subject: Re: JUnit Anti-patterns
msgSnippet: ... that. :( Hi Stephen, I d be inclined to argue that that example is *not* really an anti-pattern, but rather a limitation of the API. But, I guess you could
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Stephen Smith <steve@...> wrote:
>
> I'd suggest using Assert#assertEquals(String,Object,Object) to compare
> two different java.util.Collection implementations (e.g. ArrayList,
> Arrays.ArrayList) - but there's no real API-based solution to that one
> unfortunately. If there's one comparison I tend to trip up on, it's
that. :(

Hi Stephen,

I'd be inclined to argue that that example is *not* really an
anti-pattern, but rather a limitation of the API. But, I guess you
could call it a gotcha that you have to be careful of.

Cheers,
Joe
